sentences: Zaq (stylized as ZAQ, born March 16, 1988) is a Japanese singer, lyricist, composer and arranger signed to Lantis.
section: N/A
== Biography ==
== Biography ==

sentences: Zaq began to learn the piano at age three.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: However, she failed all her auditions.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In junior high school, Zaq's favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: She is self-taught in composing and her works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: She started writing songs for other artists in 2012, and made her solo debut with Lantis with the single "Sparkling Daydream" released on October 24, 2012; the title song is used as the opening theme to the 2012 anime series Love, Chunibyo & Other Delusions.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Her second single "Alteration" was released on January 23, 2013 and the title song is used as the opening theme to the 2013 anime series Sasami-san@Ganbaranai.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: She released two more singles in 2013, which are "Gekijouron" (激情論) and "Extra Revolution" (エキストラレボリューション).
section: == Biography ==

sentences: They were released on October 21 and October 23, 2014, respectively, and were used as the second opening theme for High School DxD New and the opening theme for I Couldn't Become a Hero, So I Reluctantly Decided to Get a Job..
section: == Biography ==

sentences: On January 29, 2014, Zaq released her fifth single, "Voice", which is used as the opening theme for the second season of Love, Chunibyo & Other Delusions.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: On April 16, 2014, she released her first album, Noisy Lab..
section: == Biography ==

sentences: She then again released another single, "Overdriver" on August 20, 2014, and is used for the anime Rail Wars!
section: == Biography ==
== Biography ==

sentences: On June 12, 2016, Zaq had her first concert in the United States.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: This concert was at the Atlantic City Convention Center in New Jersey as part of the AnimeNEXT 2016 convention.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: On July 13, 2016, Zaq released her second album No Rule My Rule.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: It was released in two editions: a standard edition, and a limited edition which includes a music video, a making-of video, and recordings of live performances.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Her third album Z-ONE was released on May 16, 2018.
section: == Biography ==
